result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles E Brooks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Per RASO - mandatory jail time has been served

Defendant Charles E Brooks in court with attorney Jillian J. Dickson-Igl and atty Xavier Solis.  Defendant Charles E Brooks in custody.  Thomas Jerome Coaty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Atty Solis has filed a motion to w/draw as counsel on the case.
New counsel has been appointed.
BTC: Motion to w/draw as counsel is granted.
Matter is resolved.
State moves to amend count one to DC as a repeater.
BTC: Motion to amend count one to DC as a repeater granted.
Plea - Cts 1&2 - NC.
BTC: Cts 1&2 - GUILTY.
90 days RCJ each count to run conc;
cfts;
cc are waived
Jury trial on July 16, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Status conference on July 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Charles E Brooks in court with attorney Xavier Solis.  Defendant Charles E Brooks in custody.  Thomas Jerome Coaty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Parties are in negotiations of the case.
Deft has a signature bond but is still in custody and cannot post the money for the GPS monitoring.
Parties would stipulate to the GPS monitoring be removed and the deft be tested several times a week.
Deft is making a request for a speedy trial.
State would not agree with the modification of bond with the trial request.
BTC: Trial date set.

  Jury trial scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 08:15 am.  Status conference scheduled for July 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on June 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 14, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Defendant is ordered to have SCRAM unit installed and monitored by Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) - 524 S. Main Street, 3rd floor (262-632-1780.  $208 advanced fee for installment of SCRAM must be paid prior to release from jail.  No contact with 1732 Mead St or Hamilton Park.   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Charles E Brooks in court with attorney Erin Joy Larsen.  Defendant Charles E Brooks in custody.  Randall Schneider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 14, 2015 at 03:15 pm.  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
